definition: to breathe/to suck in/to absorb/to inhale
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the absorbability of the PVC infusion sets to ciprofloxacin.
sentences.chinese: 目的考察PVC输液袋对环丙沙星的吸附性。

sentences.english: The more clay particles percent content, the larger adsorption capacity.
sentences.chinese: 土壤中粘粒百分含量越高，吸附性就越强。

sentences.english: It is shown that the improved coal ash adsorbent can obviously heighten the absorptivity of ions.
sentences.chinese: 证明粉煤灰吸附剂显著提高了对水中离子的吸附性。

sentences.english: While chalcopyrite adsorbs gold most weakly with its adsorption capacity 9%only.
sentences.chinese: 吸附性相对最弱的是黄铜矿，吸附量仅为9%。

sentences.english: The absorbability of petrolic oil on the expansive graphite has been researched.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了膨胀石墨对汽机油的吸附性性能。

sentences.english: The influence of hydroxyl content and concentration on adsorbability was also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 并研究了不同浓度和羟基含量对吸附性的影响。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the absorbability of the PVC infusion sets to enoxacin.
sentences.chinese: 目的考察PVC输液袋对依诺沙星的吸附性。

sentences.english: Adsorption of good, proper fulfillment coverage.

definition: to adhere to a surface/to absorb/to draw in/(fig.) to attract/(chemistry) adsorption
porous/having many holes (e.g. filter gauze or sieve)
